intro: Chazaliella abrupta, commonly known as the sharp-leaved chazalina, is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, sharply serrated leaves. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect stems that bear small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Chazaliella abrupta is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and astringent properties.
